intro: Crantzia polyantha, commonly known as the many-flowered crantzia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, showy flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, which bloom throughout the summer months. Crantzia polyantha is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
